content:
That sounds like a blast! However, I have to clarify that it's unlikely you'll be able to bring your acoustic guitar or any music gear into a music festival, as most festivals have strict rules against bringing instruments into the festival grounds. The focus of a music festival is typically on enjoying the performances by the scheduled artists, rather than on jamming or playing your own music.

Instead, you might consider leaving your guitar at home and focusing on enjoying the music and atmosphere of the festival. You can still bring some earplugs, a portable charger for your phone, and a small backpack with snacks, water, and sunscreen to ensure you have a comfortable and enjoyable experience.

If you're looking to play your guitar, you might consider finding a local park or other outdoor spot to jam with friends before or after the festival. Many cities also have open mic nights or music meetups where you can play with other musicians.

I hope this helps, and I'm sure you'll have a great time at the festival!
